segment.source: Understanding AppLocker rule collections (Windows 10)
segment.target: Understanding AppLocker rule collections (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic explains the five different types of AppLocker rules used to enforce AppLocker policies.
segment.target: This topic explains the five different types of AppLocker rules used to enforce AppLocker policies.

segment.source: Understanding AppLocker rule collections
segment.target: Understanding AppLocker rule collections

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic explains the five different types of AppLocker rules used to enforce AppLocker policies.
segment.target: This topic explains the five different types of AppLocker rules used to enforce AppLocker policies.

segment.source: An AppLocker rule collection is a set of rules that apply to one of five types:
segment.target: An AppLocker rule collection is a set of rules that apply to one of five types:

segment.source: Executable files: .exe and .com
segment.target: Executable files: .exe and .com

segment.source: Windows Installer files: .msi, mst, and .msp
segment.target: Windows Installer files: .msi, mst, and .msp

segment.source: Scripts: .ps1, .bat, .cmd, .vbs, and .js
segment.target: Scripts: .ps1, .bat, .cmd, .vbs, and .js

segment.source: DLLs: .dll and .ocx
segment.target: DLLs: .dll and .ocx

segment.source: Packaged apps and packaged app installers: .appx
segment.target: Packaged apps and packaged app installers: .appx

segment.source: If you use DLL rules, a DLL allow rule has to be created for each DLL that is used by all of the allowed apps.
segment.target: If you use DLL rules, a DLL allow rule has to be created for each DLL that is used by all of the allowed apps.

segment.source: Important: Each app can load several DLLs, and AppLocker must check each DLL before it is allowed to run.
segment.target: Important: Each app can load several DLLs, and AppLocker must check each DLL before it is allowed to run.

segment.source: Therefore, creating DLL rules might cause performance problems on some computers.
segment.target: Therefore, creating DLL rules might cause performance problems on some computers.

segment.source: Denying some DLLs from running can also create app compatibility problems.
segment.target: Denying some DLLs from running can also create app compatibility problems.

segment.source: As a result, the DLL rule collection is not enabled by default.
segment.target: As a result, the DLL rule collection is not enabled by default.

segment.source: For info about how to enable the DLL rule collection, see Enable the DLL rule collection.
segment.target: For info about how to enable the DLL rule collection, see Enable the DLL rule collection.

segment.target: Related topics
